intro: Rauvolfia sarapiquensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquia arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and research purposes.
